# Our Activities

## The Psicostat Meetings

:::{.smaller}
- We meet twice a month on Zoom  
- Each meeting lasts one hour and includes one presentation  
- A lot of space is reserved for discussion (*the heart of Psicostat*)  
- Topics: innovative statistical methods in Psychology, theoretical tutorials, projects, experimental designs, reflections on research, and societal impact  
- **Anyone** is welcome to attend and present!  
- **Omnia sunt communia!** ‚Äì All materials are shared, presenters can be contacted for info or collaborations  
- Presentations can serve as informal oral pre-registrations  
- International mailing list with ~**300** members  
- **Stay tuned!** [https://psicostat.dpss.psy.unipd.it/Activities.html](https://psicostat.dpss.psy.unipd.it/Activities.html)
:::

# ARCA

## In 2021/22, ARCA Was Born

:::{.smaller}

**Applied Research Courses Academy (ARCA)** [[website](https://www.dpss.unipd.it/applied-research-courses-academy-arca)]

- Focused on applied research tools in Psychology  
- High-level technical-methodological skills  
- Courses for students to professors *(for now!)*  
- Each course: 20 hours, 10‚Äì15 participants  
- Some of the courses: PsychoPy3, EEGLAB, fNIRS, R, RMarkdown, Shiny Apps, Open Science Tools, Pupillometry

## ARCA Summer School


The Summer School consists of four independent weekly modules, led by academic and non-academic experts about programming experiments, analyzing EEG, fNIRS and online Eye-Tracking data and literate programming with Quarto.

![[https://www.unipd.it/en/arca-initiative](https://www.unipd.it/en/arca-initiative)](img/arca-summer-school.png){fig-align="center"}
